subject: Personal Finance
title: Sunk Costs in Daily Life
description: A quick win: understand Sunk Costs in Daily Life.

hook.text: You paid $100 for a gym membership this month. It's raining. Should you force yourself to go? Economically, no.

buildup.text: A sunk cost is money already spent that you can't recover regardless of what you do next.

discovery.text: Rational decisions should only consider future costs and benefits. Past spending is irrelevant.

twist.text: But we're not rational. We eat bad food to 'get our money's worth' and watch terrible movies we paid for.

climax.text: Recognizing sunk costs in career choices, relationships, and projects frees you to make better decisions.

punchline.text: What's spent is spent. Look forward.
